title: Observing How the Universe Changed over Time

previous.title: Estimating the Size of the Observable Universe

next.title: Observing How the Universe Changed over Time

content:
The distribution and concentration of matter in the Universe for sizes larger than a galaxy is called the large-scale structure of the Universe. Astronomers can measure the distance to billions of galaxies using data from the Rubin Observatory. Using the distances and position of galaxies astronomers can create a map of the observable Universe that reveals this large-scale structure. This structure is possible to see by viewing a concentration map of a region of the Universe.

Here is a sample galaxy concentration map. Examine the color legend at the map bottom. White areas of the map are places that Rubin Observatory has not observed the sky.

question.title: Question #1
question.label: Name a city in your country that has a high population density.
